title: (x) BBC Digital Text - Tiresias {David John Earls}
content:
Whats the type used by the BBC on its digital text service?   
   
Thank you
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content: It would help us if you would please provide a link or a sample of it, rather than ask us to find it first.

Here you go, I believe you're looking for this:   
   
 [http://www.bitstream.com/categories/products/fonts/tiresias/screenfont.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824091613/http:/www.bitstream.com/categories/products/fonts/tiresias/screenfont.html)   
   
Apparently, its actually illegal to use any other font in the UK for subtitling on digital television (no, really), and BBC use it for text services on DVB too. So that covers digital terrestrial broadcasts (Freeview), but I am not sure about digital satellite (Sky) or digital on demand (Homechoice).
